File attribute
The "File" type attribute allows users to upload, store, view, sign, and delete files in the context of the System object. This attribute is typically named "Attachment" and provides a relation between objects and files uploaded into the System.

File attachment
The ability to work with files is regulated by the appropriate
access permissions
.
Depending on the selected visual, file upload to the System can be performed in two ways:
From disk
— a dialog window will open to select a file:
From System
— a modal window will open to select files previously uploaded to the System:
In the open window, the object type must be selected in the corresponding field.
By default, the "Object type" field is set to the current type.
To access the list of available types, click the
button, which will open a modal window where the following types are available for selection:
Object types that the user has read access to;
Object types that contain file attributes.
After this, the file can be selected in two ways depending on the "Select object" switch:
If the switch is active, select an object of the specified type from the left table, and the files associated with the selected object will appear in the right table;
If the switch is inactive, no object is selected, and the list of files associated with all objects of the specified type will be displayed.
When attaching a file, its classification must be determined. By default, the system will display a list of all classifications.
The "Attachment" attribute supports file versioning. Thus, when a file is modified, its previous version will still be available for viewing.
Files can also be attached through
widgets
in the "Files" section.
